game

Class Ghost

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameObject
      • game.Ghost
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Character
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ambusher, Chaser, Ignorant, Whim

    public abstract class Ghost
extends GameObject
implements Character
    Ghost superclass which manages all aspects of ghost functionality.

      • getTarget

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getTarget(Game game)
        Retrieves a list containing the x and y distances to the target and manipulate it to fit certain conditions.
        (if frightened or invisible use randomised target positions, if outside the grid bounds set them to be within)
        Parameters:
        game - The Game object
        Returns:
        A list containing the modified x distance and y distance to the target.

      • setTargetDirection

        public void setTargetDirection(Game game)
        Using the difference in lengths from the ghost's target, derive a hierarchy of directions for which a ghost should decide to move in at an intersection.
        Parameters:
        game - The Game object

      • followTarget

        public void followTarget(Game game)
        Iterate through the ghost's direction hierarchy and attempt to follow it in order, if it is possible to turn in that direction.
        Additionally allows ghosts to move backwards from where they came from only if it's a dead-end.

        NOTE: Calls the method conductReverseMovement() within this method.
        Parameters:
        game - The Game object

      • conductReverseMovement

        public void conductReverseMovement(Game game)
        Allow ghosts to rebound in the direction they came from if and only if they reach a dead-end.

        NOTE: This method is called within followTarget()
        Parameters:
        game - The Game object
